title: Unable to login
body:
I have been unable to login to the client for the past 24-48 hours. Each time the login gets stuck on authentication and then throws an error, "An unexpected error has occurred while logging in. Please try again. if this issue persists, contact support at support.riotgames.com" 

I have submitted a trouble ticket but wanted to see if anyone else is having this issue.

replies.body:
I know this situation has been confusing, but that's why we ask for logs and routes so we can all get a better idea of what's happening.   Our servers do crap out sometimes and I'm no stranger to admitting when it does, but that's not the case for this specific situation.  I know you guys have gone through a few steps already as well, which is definitely appreciated and helps a lot!  

Being able to connect to EU but not NA can be caused by a variety of issues, not just a server one.  You may have an ISP node, for example, that is having issues routing you to the game server.  Routing to EU would change that route to another location, and miss that faulty node to allow you to connect.

Steps like Configuring DNS through the connection guide, and running traceroutes with WinMTR helps us determine that.  We don't have magic wands, as much as we wish we did.  Fixes aren't always easy and we don't always see everything that's happening, that's why these steps help a lot even if they might require a bit more legwork sometimes.

Continue chatting with your Specialists and they'll keep working with you until a resolution is found.  LudusBonus is standing by!

This is the reply I was given. 

"Alright, so after looking at those winmtr scans you sent me, it looks like you are experiencing ISP issues :/ This could definitely be causing your issue. I see both high packet loss and some ping spikes. I do see your DNS has switched back to private, so you may want to try that again. However, you'll most likely want to reach out to your ISP support and have them fix it on their end. You should also ask for a tier 2 agent and try to send him those winmtr scans :) Let me know if you have any questions, but once they fix the issue on their end you should be good to go :D"

If I had ISP issues, your game client wouldn't be the only problem I would be experiencing. I don't have any issues on any other game client, or any other issues for that matter. Other players have reported identical issues so I would recommend looking at your end.

*edit* MY DNS is NOT set to a private one and has been set on google open DNS for a few months now. 

*edit* looking at op.gg, I was in an URF match two days ago and I haven't been able to login since then. That is NOT an ISP problem

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2017-08-19T17:13:56.534+0000)
>
> This is the reply I was given. 
> 
> "Alright, so after looking at those winmtr scans you sent me, it looks like you are experiencing ISP issues :/ This could definitely be causing your issue. I see both high packet loss and some ping spikes. I do see your DNS has switched back to private, so you may want to try that again. However, you'll most likely want to reach out to your ISP support and have them fix it on their end. You should also ask for a tier 2 agent and try to send him those winmtr scans :) Let me know if you have any questions, but once they fix the issue on their end you should be good to go :D"
> 
> If I had ISP issues, your game client wouldn't be the only problem I would be experiencing. I don't have any issues on any other game client, or any other issues for that matter. Other players have reported identical issues so I would recommend looking at your end.
> 
> *edit* MY DNS is NOT set to a private one and has been set on google open DNS for a few months now.

And your ISP isn't Comcast. So, back at square one?

My ISP is Charter Spectrum and I've tried to work with them with issues before that were outside of their service area and it was a dead end. They won't do anything outside of that and frankly, this isn't worth the hassle trying to get them to do anything. If Riot won't look at their end then I'll just uninstall the game and wash my hands of this madness.

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-19T17:20:46.951+0000)
>
> My ISP is Charter Spectrum and I've tried to work with them with issues before that were outside of their service area and it was a dead end. They won't do anything outside of that and frankly, this isn't worth the hassle trying to get them to do anything. If Riot won't look at their end then I'll just uninstall the game and wash my hands of this madness.

What part of country? I'm in CO

I regret I couldn't be of more help here.  :(  As this thread has been given as much clarity and assistance as it can and has turned into a back and forth of ticket responses, I'll be locking the thread at this time.  If you have any further questions or concerns, reach out to your Specialist in your ticket as he has the context for your specific case.

Damn, you've been really patient and I appreciate it!  This issue can happen if your network is blocking access to our services, but the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide should help fix that.
Why do you still think that? So many people are running into this, and the tech team keeps sending everyone the same useless connection issues article. It's clearly on your guys' end.

Hey ViXa, League is always online so connection issues are super common.  The connection guide helps rule out possibilities with the most common fixes to issues like this, so suggesting not to do that is both a disservice to you as well as the tech team.  To be frank, it wouldn't be beneficial to pull solutions out of our ass when we can run through steps that will potentially resolve your issue.

That said, I know the guide doesn't resolve every case.  For your specific issue, your best bet may be to hit up our tech team through a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so they can review your log - via [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) - and find out what's going on.

But you can't. You cannot run through solutions in this case, as you have yet to give any user a solution. Your logic makes sense on the first and second post. But by the 13th post, if someone has the exact same problem, and already has admitted to doing the exact same steps to try to fix it, why would you beat the dead horse and tell them to go through that connection guide again?

Expecting different results, that's insanity. Whatever you are pulling out of your ass are anything but solutions. So I'd step up your tetris game and see how far you can work your way in there, because at this point all I see are more people encountering the exact, to a point, exact same issue - and no logical answer yet. If anything, it is as if you actually deliberately ignore anyones answers about the situation. It actually sets back any hopeful progress from being done.

Makes me want to smack my head against whatever thick layer of obliviousness is preventing any legitimate solution is being found, especially when the only response to people sending in the logs is to do the same thing over again by a different support member. By the end of the weekend when we see a post apologizing about how it was an error on the authentication end. So I'd put on those rubber gloves and pull out any solution up there like a doctor given prostate exam because in all honesty - it is better then what these people have gotten.

And I'm not the one having these issues, just speaking for those who are.

Edit: Sorry, after re-reading this, I didn't mean for it to come off as rude as it did, it's just frustrating to see. I respect the work you guys are doing and I hope the problems solved soon, I just ate overly-regurgitated responses.

So, Kr1sys was able to successfully authenticate on a different region and get into the game, (euw as an example). But when the switch was reverted, he/she, was unable to authenticate on the North American region. This leads me to believe it's an issue with their NA Authentication. 

Disabling my firewall and still not being able to connect means it's not my PC. Adding all kinds of port forwards and verifying nothing on my router's security has changed means it's not my network. Packets being dropped on Riots end and other users being able to successfully login to the game client in a different region means its Riots problem. 

The frustrating part is getting that to the network engineers but in order to do that, they have to walk through these initials steps.

None of the steps fixed my issue and I have an active trouble ticket open with the HRT files attached.

Looking through my RADS files, I'm missing the lol_air_client folder

*edit* being a network admin, I've learned a great deal of patience lol
Sorry the steps weren't able to get you through.  Having a ticket with logs attached is a solid step, our tech team will reach out as soon as they can!

Looks like it's on Riots end, but they aren't doing anything to fix it or are unaware of the problem.

Had a friend go through the same problem, exact same steps yesterday.

They gave them the exact same responses that they gave you.

But they were able to log into the EUW servers.

It's clearly on their end, I don't know why at this point they are still trying to push it off as if it's on the users end.

Wonder when they'll fix it. Would love to see a riot member actually address this. Seen many of these posts recently with the exact same problem, especially on reddit.

i have the same issue with my league as well. i tried reinstalling, fixing compatability for windows 10 , everything that i saw on the internet but it still wont let me open league. heres a pic of what pops out after i click on my league. http://imgur.com/a/LTFCA
http://imgur.com/a/LTFCA

I found this thread that was posted for that exact error message. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/L9wALU3z-criot-gamesleague-of-legendslibcurldll-is-either-not-designed-to-run-on-windows

Unfortunately the Riot reply was not helpful.

I have the same issue.  I've submitted a ticket to support about 10 hours ago and have heard nothing yet.

multiple restarts, HRT, Tried to force a repatch but the app crashed, did a reinstall, nothing.
Yikes, 10 hours ago. What patch version are you currently on?
That's the same version I am on. I tried a DNS flush and reboot but that did not resolve the issue.

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-18T13:37:37.407+0000)
>
> That's the same version I am on. I tried a DNS flush and reboot but that did not resolve the issue.

Yeah, Tried all that.  Game is literally the only thing not working, so it's nothing on my end that some standard repairs or fixes would resolve.

I'll keep an eye on my ticket and if they get around to it and provide a fix i'll post it here since I won't get to it until late today

I don't have any issues logging into the Guild Wars 2 Client or the Everquest client. The LoL client is the only one I am unable to login. None of the resolutions on the connection issues page resolve the issue. I logged into my home router and checked everything and nothing has changed. I was able to login two days ago from today and played a game with no issues and now I cannot login. 

I threw the HRT files at my support ticket but who knows how long that will take for them to get to. 

I tried turning off my firewall and that still didn't fix it. 

Router firmware update in progress. Will post after that's done.

*edit* I've went through the entire connection issues page, disabled my firewall etc ad nauseam and nothing has resolved the problem.

While going through all the steps in connection issues didn't resolve for the NA servers I WAS able to get logged in and play on the PBE servers. Question for you guys though, is your ISP comcast? That's who I have wondering if it might be a problem with how they're routing traffic to the NA servers
No, my ISP is not Comcast
Interesting. I have no clue what's causing this now and am stuck waiting :(

It has to be an issue with their authentication server. It's like the handshake is failing. I don't have access to any of that data or I would have already looked into it. 

Literally nothing has changed with my home network since I was able to successfully connect two days ago.

Here's what I got, not able to test until later: I suggest the following steps to get you in the client:

1) Run the game as Administrator

Right click on the short cut for League of Legends
Select Properties
Check the box labelled "Run as Administrator" under the Compatibility tab and click apply.
2) I see you have alot of processes running on your computer. Some of which could be interfering with League of Legends, especially overwolf. To eliminate the possibility of that happening, let's turn off your unnecessary start up processes. This has the added benefit of making your PC boot up faster :)

Go to your start menu and type in the search area, "Command Prompt"
Open Command Prompt and type msconfig and then hit enter
A window shall open, select Selective Startup and uncheck Load Startup items.
Click Apply, OK and then restart your PC.
If your issue persists, the hextech repair tool can troubleshoot your game and might fix your issue for you. When you download it, make sure to run it as admin. If it is unable to identify or fix the issue, please send me the logs the hextech repair tool generates so I can dig deeper into your issue.

I have had this client set to run as admin for the last few years, so that's not a resolution for me. 

The second "fix" also did not resolve the issue. 

Thanks for posting what was sent to you but I leaning towards an issue on Riot's side.

*edit* HRT crashed lol

http://imgur.com/a/uEJSb

*edit* It would seem the technician working my ticket didn't even bother to read the HRT files I attached to it. 

It's also equally frustrating when the tier 1 support recommends power cycling your router/modem and running things as administrator.

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-18T19:10:13.258+0000)

Yeah, same here.

Tried HRT several times last night, always crashed when trying to force repatch.  Tried the above steps, nothing.

Just deleted the entire league folder and in process of reinstalling

Client is updating, but still having the same error upon trying to log in.

Definitely Riot's issue

I have the same issue, tried -everything- and no luck... Really hope the server downtime coming up will fix it. It's obnoxious not being able to play with my friends. Every other game works fine. The most frustrating part with this whole thing is this has been an issue for a long while now, and only recently resurfaced. Riot get it together... If I can log into EUW fine but not NA then your servers are having issues. I'm on Comcast, what's everyone elses ISP?

I'm on Comcast as well. If you guys haven't already I'd recommend contacting them as well. When I chatted in to them they said they were going to have to have there techs give me a call back to help fix it so it sounds like it may be an issue on their end.

Comcast. 

Newbcakez is not.

Its riots side
If I change region I can get in the game just fine.  But sure. **It's my computer**

Here's more of the reply I got after sending a second batch of HRT files to my "technician" 

"1) I'd like you to make sure you've installed the latest Windows Updates. League of Legends is only optimized to work best when on the latest version of Windows.

2) I suggest switching from a private DNS to a public DNS. After you set this, you will also need to flush your DNS and then reboot your computer."

Seriously dude? 

"To further investigate your connection, I will need a network trace from a program called WinMTR and a Network Analysis.

Please download the WinMTR (for free) here, then Unzip the contents and run the x32 version, if that version does not work then use x64.

In the Host field, enter in the following addresses one at a time and select Start.

*NA Server:
192.64.170.252
104.160.131.1
Google.com

After the trace is running for 5 minutes, select Export TEXT and save the log as a text file. Especially make sure to name the Google one as something that ends with .txt instead of .com . Run the test for all 3 addresses and attach the logs to your reply.

I will also need a Network Analysis which you can find here. This requires java in your browser and may only work in Internet Explorer. Finally, please send me updated HRT logs."

Riot's game client it the ONLY game client that I cannot connect to. But sure, it's my network and my PC. 

*double facepalm*

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-08-19T03:40:20.085+0000)

> 
> I will also need a Network Analysis which you can find here. This requires java in your browser and may only work in Internet Explorer. Finally, please send me updated HRT logs."
> 
> Riot's game client it the ONLY game client that I cannot connect to. But sure, it's my network and my PC. 
> 
> *double facepalm*

I'm just now to this step. So stupid. They want me essentially just keep uninstalling, disabling all sorts of stuff that has nothing to do to impact the fact I can connect to their EU server without a problem but I do have one with NA.

They're legit wasting our time and not interested in fixing it. Canned responses despite spelling out for support that I can simply change to a different server and it works perfectly.

Here's to 10+ hours before I get another canned response.

Well, their tier 1 support desk has a check list of stuff they have to try before they can escalate a ticket to next level. At least, that's how most tiered technical support area's work. 

It's just frustrating having to jump through all of these hoops.

> [{quoted}](name=Newbcakez,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=E9RgGjgZ,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-19T03:59:45.393+0000)

> 
> It's just frustrating having to jump through all of these hoops.

I'd have no problem with jumping through hoops if the tech I'm assigned wasn't responding to my ticket as he's walking out the door.

Bumping because this is still a real issue...spent a couple days trying to solve the issue myself before creating a ticket. same issues as everyone here as well as it being the only game/server with an issue.
bumping for visibility.
Same here. Went through all the steps in the connection issues as well and nothing resolved. Waiting for a response to my ticket.
